result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damian J Dilley

records.addlTxt: No violent/abusive contact with TLD and TAD, and the only contact allowed is under direct supervision of L.B. All the other prior conditions remain unchanged.

Court amended the bond to no violent or abusive contact with TLD and TAD, and the only contact allowed is under direct supervision of L.B.. 10:24 AM

records.addlTxt: 9:59 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Damian J Dilley in court without counsel. Defendant stated he thought he would be appointed a court appointed atty; has Atty Lawton in his other cases. Court appointed Attorney Mark Lawton at the rate of $100.00 per hour, payment plan to be added with his other Columbia County cases. Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:20 pm. Return date scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am. 10:11 AM

10:09 AM Defendant Damian J Dilley in court.  ADA Jordan Lippert appeared  in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim has filed for contact for juvenile.  Statement by ADA Lippert objecting to bond request.   Court denied motion. Court will revisit if gets documentation of what has been done for treatment and attorney who can help who would do supervised visits.  10:23 am
Bail/bond hearing on April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Victims request to amend bond. State objects and requests a hearing.
Return date 5-4-22 at 10:00 am

10:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Damian J Dilley appeared in court. DA Yaskal stated the defendant appeared for the pretrial stating that he would like to get an attorney. Court questioned the defendant. Defendant stated he has an attorney out of Chicago, that is trying to reach attorney Mark Lawton. Court will set this for a new return date. 10:45 AM
Return date scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
The "no contact" with N.S.D.S. amended to "no violent/abusive contact" with N.S.D.S. Previous ordered conditions of no contact with T.A.D. & T.L.D. remain. Faxed to dispatch

3:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Damian J Dilley appeared in court without counsel. Hearing is in re: victims request to allow contact. Statement by victim. Statement by defendant. Statement by Atty Yaskal, objects. Court granted, amended to "no violent/abusive contact with N.S.D.S. No contact with T.A.D. or T.L.D. remain. 3:34 PM

Standard felony conditions. No contact with T.A.D, T.L.D. or N.S.D.S. Not allowed at the Hillside Terrace address in Pardeeville, WI. May return x1 with Law Enforcement to obtain personal belongings.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 03:20 pm. Return date scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Claire Edwards appeared by video for the defendant. Waived reading. Right to atty. $1,000.00 cash bond. Standard felony conditions. No contact with T.A.D, T.L.D. or N.S.D.S. Not allowed at the Hillside Terrace address in Pardeeville, WI. May return x1 with Law Enforcement to obtain personal belongings. Waived time limits.
